I can't say that this isn't a good game.  Put a lot of time and hours into it with a lot of fun.  I'm giving it a thumbs down due to the greedy nature of the developer and their inability to compensate for lost time/money.  Particularly for 2 skin sets that I put in over 80 hours into 2 rift seasons and 2000 auric cells to unlock, just to be released for purchase in the store later.  I emailed support requesting a compensation for the auric cells spent and got the same response that I do for anytime I contact Behavior.

"Thank you for all your loyalty and your interest in the game.  We really appreciate dedicated players such as you.  We're very sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.  Please do not hesitate to contact us in case you require any further assistance" 

This same response is sent from their "support" team anytime I send them an email.  

When it comes down to it, this company released rewarded rift skins just to make a few more bucks instead of just making new ones.  This deceptive developer greed speaks loudly and they have lost all of my respect, as well as my thumbs up.

I played this game for a long time as you can see from my hours. But it has finally reached the point where I canâ€™t play it anymore.
 
If you are a new player, this game will most likely be pretty fun for a while, so if youâ€™re going to play this game extremely casually (1-2 times a week for a few hours) youâ€™ll probably enjoy this game, particularly with friends. 

However, if youâ€™re going to play this game as your main game or one of your main games â€“ I canâ€™t recommend this game. The grind is unachievable, the cosmetics and DLCs are overpriced for someone starting from 0 (and the cosmetics are mediocre). However, the biggest issue is their latest involvement of Skilled-based match making. That has made games unbelievably sweaty and unfun. Skill based match making that at the high end for killer and survivor pretty much unplayable. Killers canâ€™t do much of anything, the average killer will get 2-4 hooks at high SBMM level unless they play scummy AF. But even then, itâ€™s a struggle bus. If you go to many of the top Twitch killer main streamers, youâ€™ll see the struggles. Many of them are switching to survivor. For survivor at high SBMM itâ€™s actually fairly easy (and boring) since all your teammates are typically pretty competent if youâ€™re solo queuing. However, all the killers are going play scummy AF in every game to try to get at least 1 kill (tunnelling â€“ proxy camping, etc). The SBMM has highlighted the severe imbalance between survivor and killer and has made it unenjoyable. Gens go way too fast for anyone to enjoy. The devs only care about the new player experience, and pretty much believe once they sucker you in, youâ€™ll stay forever even if youâ€™re having a bad time. And to some degree they have been correct, but this has been the breaking point for me and many other veteran players. 

Like many games, the community / survivors are very toxic. Iâ€™m speaking as a former survivor main, but who played killer casually. The devs do not care about veteran players. 

Oh and btw the SBMM score (which you canâ€™t see) is not determined by skill, but actually how long youâ€™re in the match for and if you escape/how many kills. Thatâ€™s it. Thereâ€™s nothing else to it. Itâ€™s actually less required skilled than the previous ranking system. The devs are trying to make this party game an E-Sports game, with that kind of match making. 

Also another note, there is an ever-increasing amount of cheaters/hackers in this game. Like blatant ones, not ones where it could be questionable. You can report them in game and via their ticket system online. But not much will happen if anything at all even with evidence. Half of them can unban themselves even if you did get them banned.  1/10 of the cheaters probably get perma-banned, but it takes 1+ months for Behaviour to do anything about it. 

TLDR; good for new casual players (<8hrs a week, for maybe a few hundred hours total), but game is buggy/very imbalanced, expensive, too grindy for long term players & game is riddled with hackers. SBMM is s***.
Nice

This game is loads of fun! However, If you care about ranking up don't bother letting your rank ruin your enjoyment of the game. The ranking system is designed for a specific style of play. You have to be chased and you have to do gens and you have to save your teamates in order to rank up as survivor. While that may seem reasonable, it has some serious flaws in its application. If it's all for the entity as a killer why does the entity care if as a killer i didn't break the gens or hit and down and hook all the survivors on more than one occasion and perhaps instead of hooking survivors i just decided to murder them in cold blood and oh BTW maybe the match didn't last more than 10 minutes.... If they are all dead  before escaping why does the entity care? And as survivor if I took the time to complete several gens and hide from the killer the entire game all sneaky beaky like without being chased or hit once and the other survivors happen to do just the same, why wouldn't I be rewarded for doing so? This game is fun and if you are going to play just to play then it can be an absolute blast! If you are competitive though and want to rank up, good luck! 8/10 See you in the fog!
Overall good game. Addicting.

I almost always hate my teammates, that's the only true problem with survivor, bad teammates. With killer, it's so stacked against you that if the survivors just know the basics at high ranks, they can all escape, with you getting 0 kills, playing like a SWF, and while there are plenty of garbage SWF players, their communication advantage almost always prevents 4Ks unless the killer is one of the those top-tier 0.01% of killers that can 4K with Bubba blindfolded, who are known for telling every other killer player they just need to 'getgud'. It's like one of the 2 people that can play one of those absurdly complex fighting-game characters to their full potential, and will never lose to anyone. This game is balanced around those few killer-streamers and the majority of Rank 20 survivor streamers who can't just do gens, loop, and not screw their teammates, and when they die, occasionally scream 'ThIs GaMe Is So UnFaIr To SuRvIvOrS' 'kIlLeR oP' through a cussing fit.

If you can play without getting too attached to winning (getting 4 kills or 4 escapes), the game's great. If not, you will run into the problem of 4 queue SEAL Team Claudette either finishing every gen in 3 minutes or dragging out the game just to feel superior to you, or a killer camping and tunneling everyone they can, despite the fact that almost no one in these games gets much Blood Points. Learn to loop pallets (look up 'dbd killer tiles' or 'dbd survivor tiles' on YouTube), not run to OTHER side of the map to heal (a little bit away unless killer is coming to you is good), strategies against each killer, and don't instantly throw pallets in shacks or long walls (it hurts everyone including you later).

P.S. For your sanity, probably keep gameplay minimum, and do those dailies. If you wait 3 days and come back, as soon as you do one of the three currently available dailies to you, a 4th will appear.

I wanted so badly to love this game but right now it's so utterly broken for new killers. If you like to play survivor then you're in luck, the devs obviously favor survivors so much it's painful. It wouldn't be so bad if the matchmaking weren't a total joke. A handful of rounds into the game and I constantly get matched up against people who have been trolling the game since launch and are beyond coordinated. It's not much fun when everyone but you knows what to do, and it doesn't help that the tutorial is a joke. You basically have to look outside the game for help because the tutorials don't give you a chance to get any real practice in with the killers unless you have friends play unranked rounds with you. The online community is so toxic, I've never dealt with so many keyboard warriors and trolls in my life, and my generation invented that shit. No one is helpful or offers any tips, they just tell you that you suck and spam obscenities, but you can't block them from your matchmaking so... Just be warned you're in for a long and painful "git gud" grind for decent perks with most of the killers before you'll have any chance of winning unless you're using the tiny handful of killers that can teleport/blink around the map, but then you'll be a "toxic killer" and don't even think about camping or you'll get shit for that too. Basically everything you do will be wrong for a long time. This game needs work, badly. As soon as Last Year: The Nightmare comes out I'll probably jump ship.

The game is amazing. Has a few bugs which are always easy to fix, however the reporting system needs a lot of work. I've recently been banned for "unsportsmanlike" behavior, and I've never done such a thing. It was most likely some hot-headed killer who reported me for looping them, or just playing the game. I truly believe that a game is more "fair" when you have a good reporting system. I haven't been banned for long, but I still think it was very unjust and unfair for me. I never would be toxic, even if things do anger me. I could probably say this for many people that your reporting system should be fair and just so it could be a much better way of actually banning people for a reason. If someone were to be banned, maybe you should have receipts as to why they were banned so they don't have to constantly question what they've done wrong. Knowing this now, it frightens me to even play this game, knowing that there's going to be someone who's just petty enough to report someone just because they made them angry.
